How do you post albums from Imgur on the forums? Not the link, but the album, so you can view it on the forums?

> 
> 
> 3 minutes ago, Spaceception said:
> 
> 
> How do you post albums from Imgur on the forums? Not the link, but the album, so you can view it on the forums?
> 

Click on the "i" button at the very right of the editor toolbar, paste the album ID there (not the full link !) and click OK.

Please use this thread for policy and informational questions rather than bug reports and tech support.

I'm almost completely certain this has been asked before, but the search function is throwing a hissy at me:- is there any chance you guys have data from the old forum circa 0.18 - 0.25? If so, is there any chance I could retrieve any posts I might have made? There's an old image there that I'm trying to find. Thankyou!
Laughing Man, under "activity" in your profile, you can review posts you've submitted. Your oldest post there is from 29 May 2013. Is what you're looking for not there?

I have a bad feeling it was from before the great forum crash. I remember having to recreate this account because the old one was lost along with the forum. I'm guessing anything that was on there is irrecoverable?

We will have to refer this sort of technical question to [@KasperVld](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/40700-kaspervld/). What can you tell him about what you're looking for? The more specific the better.

I have a serious question and I want to make sure to follow the forum rules - as my goal for 2016 is to not get any infractions! (I believe I had more than my share in 2015).

If I create a thread for the sole purpose of sharing the custom graphics I've created from the requests of others for the use on various projects, would the page have to have some sort of Creative Commons statements that moders must have to display their mods on the forum? If/when I set up this thread, I want to make sure I do things the CORRECT way...

> 
> 
> 10 hours ago, adsii1970 said:
> 
> 
> I have a serious question and I want to make sure to follow the forum rules - as my goal for 2016 is to not get any infractions! (I believe I had more than my share in 2015).
> 
> 
> 
> 
> If I create a thread for the sole purpose of sharing the custom graphics I've created from the requests of others for the use on various projects, would the page have to have some sort of Creative Commons statements that moders must have to display their mods on the forum? If/when I set up this thread, I want to make sure I do things the CORRECT way...
> 

Custom logos and such aren't usually considered add-ons so the Add On Posting Rules don't apply (including the requirement for a license). That said, they *are* your work so it it would be courteous to lay out for users how you would and wouldn't like for them to be used, whether that's through a formal license or just through a statement in the OP.
